engine

Class WorldObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.WorldObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Projectile, Unit

    public abstract class WorldObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Every existing object in a level is a WorldObject. A WorldObject is an object that has a position in the world and a given radius - all WorldObjects has the shape of a circle.

    • Method Detail

      • onTick

        public abstract void onTick()
        Defines the change of state of the object every game tick. This generally includes movement. Collision detection should not be done here.

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(WorldObject o)
        Check if this WorldObject intersects with the given worldObject.
        Parameters:
        o - The object collision is going to be checked towards.
        Returns:
        True if the given WorldObject intersects with this object. Returns false otherwise.

      • applyKnockback

        public void applyKnockback(double originX,
                  double originY,
                  double force,
                  int duration)
        Adds a new knockback effekt to the Worldobject. The orldObject will be pushed away from the origin of the knockback with the given force during the given duration.
        Parameters:
        originX - x-Position of the source of the Knockback.
        originY - y-Position of the source of the Knockback.
        force - How fast the target will be pushed by the knockback.
        duration - How many engineTicks the knockback should last.

      • isOutOfBounds

        public boolean isOutOfBounds(double width,
                    double height)
        Checks if the object is entirely out of bounds. I.e if the entire circumference of the object is outside the box created by the (0,0) position and the (width,height) position.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the bounds from coordinate 0.
        height - The height of the bounds from coordinate 0.
        Returns:
        True if the object is outside the bounds, false otherwise.

      • teleportTo

        public void teleportTo(double x,
              double y)
        Instantly moves to object to the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-position of the location.
        y - The y-position of the location.

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        The radius of the objects circular shape.
        Returns:
        The radius of the object.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        The x-position of the objects center.

        the x-position of the objects center.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        The y-position of the objects center.
        Returns:
        the y-position of the objects center.

      • getDrawPriority

        public int getDrawPriority()
        The drawPriority of an object defines the priority the object has above other objects to be drawn over them. An object with a higher draw priority should therefore be drawed after an object with a lower drawPriority. In the case of equality there is no rule except that consistency should be adopted.
        Returns:
        the drawPriority of the WorldObject.

      • getState

        public WorldObjectState getState()
        Get the state of this WorldObject;
        Returns:
        The state of the WorldObject.

      • isKnockbacked

        public boolean isKnockbacked()
        If the WorldObject currently is affected by any knockback effects.
        Returns:
        True if the WorldObject is knockbacked, false otherwise.
